body_html:
That's cool. Seemed reasonable that broadcasting might generalize as a useful feature for many binary operators, just like it is for basic math... I have a use case for broadcasting in this particular binary operation, but I'm just `.tile`ing my labels now, and it works just fine, so it's a minor efficiency point. Just in case solving a more general problem would solve this one: Can I hack broadcasting together with what currently exists? Maybe a `broadcast` node would be useful?
…
On Jan 17, 2018 8:28 PM, "Yan Facai (颜发才)" ***@***.***> wrote: Perhaps it's safer to broadcast your labels explicitly. I'm afraid that the feature would be unexpected (or even wrong) for user in most cases. — You are receiving this because you authored the thread. Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub <#16197 (comment)>, or mute the thread <https://github.com/notifications/unsubscribe-auth/ABZE9O_nkt-E1E9gooCYvz9dG6YCAkEEks5tLqxCgaJpZM4Rh8bo> .

body:
That's cool.  Seemed reasonable that broadcasting might generalize as a
useful feature for many binary operators, just like it is for basic math...
I have a use case for broadcasting in this particular binary operation, but
I'm just `.tile`ing my labels now, and it works just fine, so it's a minor
efficiency point.

Just in case solving a more general problem would solve this one:

Can I hack broadcasting together with what currently exists?  Maybe a
`broadcast` node would be useful?

On Jan 17, 2018 8:28 PM, "Yan Facai (颜发才)" <notifications@github.com> wrote:

> Perhaps it's safer to broadcast your labels explicitly. I'm afraid that
> the feature would be unexpected (or even wrong) for user in most cases.
